poem:
"From a Solitude of Grief"

The old man ascends,
snowshoes stuttering in the white silence,
his heart bound to the naked peak.
A widow mourning, 
and the mountains pours its peace - 
a salve upon his wintered spirit.
Steel yearns towards the sky,
an echo of forgotten youth,
In this brave exploration of solitude.
The mountains address our barren souls,
and in their shadow, we find solace.
